WEEKLY SHELBY NEWS:
ESTABLISHED IN 1840. -- CIRULATION ABOUT 3,000.
HENRI F. MIDDLETON, EDITOR AND PROPRIETOR.
"Against the insidious wiles of foreign influence, (I conjure you to believe me, fellow-citizens.) the jealously of a free people ought to be constantly awake since history and experience prove that foreign influence is one of the msot baneful foes of a republican government. -- WASHINGTON,

Has always been a firm supporter of the principles first laid down by WASHINGTON, and since advocated by CLAY, WEBSTER, and others, viz: That Americans shall rule America; and protection by the Government, to American manufactures, labor and other interests.

Address,
HENRI F. MIDDLETON,
Editor Shelby News,
Shelbyville, Ky.

Office of The Shelby News, Shelbyville, Ky.
October 14, 1863
His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette, Governor, &c
In Order, No. 3, you desire citizens to recommend suitable persons, who will act, as Colonel and Lieut. Colonel under the state Guard Law.

I had, on reading the Order, determined to recommend the Mr. Otho Harding, of this county, as a person, in every way qualified, as I believe for the position of Lieut Colonel; but desired to see if he would serve. Having learned from him that he would, I now suggest him for that position. He is active, brave, educated, and while in service, had the
under the State Authorities, last Fall and Winter, had the confidence and esteem, and respect of all soldiers and officers he associated with

Yours &c most respectfully
Henri F. Middleton

Shelby Co Oct 14/63
Recm"g" for this county Otho Harding Lt Col
H. F. Middleton
